item.name: HelpAddActionButtonText
item.heading: Text
item.description:
The button text. This is an actual name of your button which will be shown on the panel.
Example: "Restart server"

item.name: HelpAddActionButtonDescription
item.heading: Description
item.description:
The button description. This parameter sets the description for the button which will be shown in tooltip when mouse is on the button.
Example: "This button restarts specified server"

item.name: HelpAddActionButtonScript
item.heading: Script
item.description:
The button script file. This is used to set path to the script. Value may differ based on the Script Path Type parameter.
Example:
If Script Path Type parameter is Relative then script file must be put to the direction where is EasyJob is located and should look like: "restart_server.ps1".
If Script Path Type parameter is Absolute then script file must be put to any other direction and should look like: "C:\your\folder\name\restart_server.ps1"

item.name: HelpAddActionButtonScriptPathType
item.heading: Script path type
item.description:
The button script path type. My be set to Relative or Absolute. Relative means that your script is in the same folder with an application executable. Absolute means that your script is located in any other folder in your system.
Example: "Relative"

item.name: HelpAddActionButtonScriptType
item.heading: Script type
item.description:
The button script type. My be set to PowerShell or Batch script.
Example: "PowerShell"

item.name: HelpAddActionButtonArguments
item.heading: Arguments
item.description:
The button arguments. You have to specify list of questions which will be asked when executiong your script.
Example: "Please specify server DNS name or IP address"

item.name: HelpConfigurationDefaultPowershellPath
item.heading: Default PowerShell path
item.description:
Absolute path to PowerShell.exe. You can specify path to new versions of PowerShell.
Example: "C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe"

item.name: HelpConfigurationDefaultCMDPath
item.heading: Default CMD path
item.description:
Absolute path to command promt.
Example: "C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe"

item.name: HelpConfigurationPowerShellArguments
item.heading: PowerShell arguments
item.description:
Additional parameters sent to PowerShell.
Example: -ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted

item.name: HelpConfigurationConsoleBackground
item.heading: Console background
item.description:
Background color of the console.
Example: Black

item.name: HelpConfigurationConsoleForeground
item.heading: Console foreground
item.description:
Color of the text in the console.
Example: Red

item.name: HelpConfigurationConsoleIgnoreColorTags
item.heading: Console ignore color tags
item.description:
Determines if special color tags are ignored during output.
Example: No

item.name: HelpConfigurationClearEventsWhenReload
item.heading: Clear events when reload
item.description:
Clear events on Events list after configuration reload from the File-> Reload config menu.
Example: Yes

item.name: HelpConfigurationBlockTabsRemove
item.heading: Block tabs remove
item.description:
Hides "Remove Tab" context menu item from when Right click on the Tab.
Example: No

item.name: HelpConfigurationBlockButtonsRemove
item.heading: Block buttons remove
item.description:
Hides "Remove button" context menu item when Right click on the buttons bar.
Example: No

item.name: HelpConfigurationBlockTabsAdd
item.heading: Block tabs add
item.description:
Hides "Add tab" context menu item when Right Click on the Tab.
Example: No

item.name: HelpConfigurationBlockButtonsAdd
item.heading: Block buttons add
item.description:
Hides "Add button" context menu item when Right click on the buttons bar.
Example: No

item.name: HelpConfigurationBlockButtonsReorder
item.heading: Block buttons reorder
item.description:
Hides "Reorder buttons" context menu item when Right click on the buttons bar.
Example: No

item.name: HelpConfigurationBlockButtonsEdit
item.heading: Block buttons edit
item.description:
Hides "Edit button" context menu item when Right click on the button.
Example: No

item.name: HelpConfigurationBlockTabsRename
item.heading: Block tabs rename
item.description:
Hides "Rename tab" context menu item when Right click on the tab.
Example: No

item.name: HelpConfigurationBlockButtonsPaste
item.heading: Block buttons paste
item.description:
Hides "Paste button" context menu item when Right click on the tab.
Example: No

item.name: HelpConfigurationBlockButtonsCopy
item.heading: Block buttons copy
item.description:
Hides "Copy button" context menu item when Right click on the tab.
Example: No

item.name: HelpConfigurationHideFileReloadConfig
item.heading: Hide File->Reload config
item.description:
Hides "File->Reload config" main menu item.
Example: No

item.name: HelpConfigurationHideFileOpenAppFolder
item.heading: Hide File->Open app folder
item.description:
Hides "File->Open app folder" main menu item.
Example: No

item.name: HelpConfigurationHideClearEventsList
item.heading: Hide File->Clear events list
item.description:
Hides "Hide File->Clear events list" main menu item.
Example: No

item.name: HelpConfigurationHideSettings
item.heading: Hide Settings
item.description:
Hides "Hide Settings" main menu item.
Example: No
Note: In order to bring back Settings menu, you have to manually find "hide_menu_item_settings" parameter in config.json and change its value to "false"

item.heading: Hide Settings->Workflow
item.description:
Hides "Hide Settings->Workflow" main menu item.
Example: No

item.name: HelpConfigurationHideSettingsWorkflowReorderTabs

item.description: Hides "Hide Settings->Workflow->Add button to current tab

item.name: HelpConfigurationHideSettingsConfiguration
item.heading: Hide Settings->Configuration
item.description:
Hides "Hide Settings->Configuration" main menu item.
Example: No
Note: In order to bring back Configuration menu, you have to manually find "hide_menu_item_settings_configuration" parameter in config.json and change its value to "false"

item.description:
Hides "Hide Help" main menu item.
Example: No
